comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Anyone know exactly where this was?  I cannot find it on old maps of Circular Quay.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Found it, as usual when looking for something else! Union Steam Ship Company of New Zealand Ltd. was at NW corner of Sussex and Margaret Streets. Nowhere near Circular Quay. 1895 map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm3443-sd&rgn=0... Kerry photo of other end of the building - from.ph/28280 or on Flickr - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2925973802/

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
It's always fascinating to see a different view of the same location!

Thanks to your research we now have a street (in Darling Harbour, Sydney) for this photo and can update our image database.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This must be one of the plague photos (not published in the famous albums) of 1900. Those workmen are disinfecting the building and wharves. The reverse view (a photo selected for the albums) is here - www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3101628254/ .

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I was right but I was wrong! - it IS in the Plague album No.1, item 12 - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/albumView.aspx?acmsID=412968&amp... or - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=823637&am... So 1900 for the date.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Thanks beachcomberaustralia.....we have changed the date to c.1900

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: " The Union Compuny'a shed is still used as a barracks for tho men employed, and will continue to be so as being the best place available. Arrangements have been made for a steam launch to take the men to and from their work so that they shall not have to pass through any portion of the citv which has been declared clean. " from SMH Monday 6/4/1900 page 5 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14304637 It was April 1900, and John Degotardi Jnr the photographer
